isis.stitle: POWER STEERING GEAR: SHEPPARD M-SERIES - PITMAN ARM - INSTALL

svcproc.title: INSTALL
svcproc.para: Proper installation of the pitman arm is critical to the safe operation of the vehicle. Follow these procedures for the attachment. Correct torque values are very important! Use lubricant where indicated. Always use a new tab lock retainer.

warning.para: If the pitman arm is not applied to the proper specifications, the pitman arm could work loose, lose its attachment and cause an accident, personal injury or death. If the pitman arm is found loose, replace the pitman arm and sector shaft. Never weld the arm or shaft.

The pitman arm should be installed after the steering gear is mounted on the vehicle so proper torque can be applied to the pitman arm. Lack of proper torque will cause looseness of the pitman arm and can cause an accident, personal injury or death.

step1.para: Install the pitman arm on the output shaft. Align the timing mark of the pitman arm with the timing mark of the output shaft ( Figure 37).
If you are reusing a tab lock retainer, inspect the assembly for broken tabs or thread damage before installation. Replace the retainer if any damage is found.
If a new retainer is required, read the instruction sheet supplied with the retainer kit carefully! Discard the parts that are not required for your application.

note.para: Tab lock retainers are supplied with three torque specifications: 225 ft-lbs. (305 Nm), 350 ft-lbs. (475 Nm), or 450 ft-lbs (610 Nm). The torque value is stamped on the face of the retainer ( Figure 38). Check the torque value stamped on your retainer and the TORQUE CHARTto be sure your retainer is correct!

figure.caption: Figure 39. Torque Value Stamped on Retainer Face

step1.para: Apply Never-Seize compound in the threads of the sector shaft and retainer and on both sides of the friction washer ( Figure 39).
Screw the retainer into the output shaft by hand and align the tabs of the retainer with the notches of the pitman arm ( Figure 40).

figure.caption: Figure 41. Align Retainer Tabs with Pitman Arm Notches

step1.para: Use the 5/8 inch or 3/4 inch Allen head socket and torque wrench to install the retainer in the output shaft by tightening the retainer ( Figure 41) to: M-80: 225 ft-lbs. (305 Nm), M-90 and 100: 350 ft-lbs. (474 Nm), M-110: 450 ft-lbs. (610 Nm).

figure.caption: Figure 42. Install Retainer in Output Shaft

important.para: Steps 7, 8 and 9 are required only if you are replacing or re-installing a pitman arm. If the pitman arm and sector shaft are both new, proceed to step 10.

note.para: You must measure output shaft to pitman arm clearance.

step1.para: After tightening the retainer, loosen and remove the retainer from the output shaft. Measure the distance from the end of the output shaft (A, Figure 42) to recessed area of the pitman arm (B, Figure 42). The acceptable dimension is: M-80 retainers: 3/32 to 5/32 inch (2.4 to 4 mm), M-90 and 100 retainers: 3/32 to 5/32 inch (2.4 to 4 mm), M-110 retainers: 1/8 to 3/16 inch (3.2 to 4.8 mm).

figure.caption: Figure 43. Measure Distance From End of Output Shaft to Recessed Area of Pitman Arm

warning.para: If the measurement does not meet the acceptable minimum or maximum tolerance, the pitman arm and sector shaft must be replaced. Failure to take the measurement or replace worn parts could result in pitman arm looseness which could lead to an accident, personal injury or death.

step1.para: If the measurement is OK, or after replacing the sector shaft and pitman arm, screw the retainer into the output shaft hand tight. Be sure to align the tabs of the retainer with the notches of the pitman arm. Refer to Figure 40.

Use a 5/8 or 3/4 inch Allen head socket and torque wrench to tighten the retainer in the output shaft ( Figure 43) to: M-80: 225 ft-lbs. (305 Nm), M-90 and 100: 350 ft-lbs. (474 Nm), M-110: 450 ft-lbs. (610 Nm).
After the specified torque value is reached, continue tightening until two of the restraining tabs of tab washer align with notches in the retainer ( Figure 44).

figure.caption: Figure 45. Align Restraining Tabs with Retainer Notches

warning.para: If the tabs and notches do not line up, tighten beyond the specified torque value until two tabs align. Never back off the retainer to align the restraining tabs.

step1.para: Use the tapered punch and hammer to lock the restraining tabs into the retainer ( Figure 45).

figure.caption: Figure 46. Lock Restraining Tabs into Retainer

warning.para: Always wear safety glasses and never use a punch that is damaged. Pieces of steel can hit your eye.

step1.para: Install the drag link. Tighten the nut to:
Install a new cotter pin in the drag link ball stud.

warning.para: Do not back off the nut to locate the cotter pin hole! Failure to install and lock the cotter pin in the ball stud could result in a hazardous vehicle operating condition, an accident, personal injury or death.

note.para: Relief plunger adjustment will be necessary if the power steering gear was changed or rebuilt. Refer to SET RELIEF PLUNGERS.
